p.s: The given text is an excerpt from the novel The Hate U Give which was written by Angie Thomas and published in 2017.
In this excerpt, Thomas describes a protestationprotest for justice for Khalil, a situation Starr finds herself in.
Throughout the text, you can see Starr's development.
Right at the beginning, while she arrives to the protestationprotest, she gets a flashback of the situation on Khalil's death.
Everyone around is screaming the words A hairbrush is not a gun and at the moment in which Starr gets back to reality, she also starts screaming that words.
Her attorney, Mrs. Ofrah is very confused about Starr's behaviour and asks, what she is doing right now.
Starr has decided to do something, not even longer talking or watching, she wants to fight for justice for Khalil with everything she has.
In a dialogue with Mrs. Ofrah she explains her the goal she is following.
As a reaction, Mrs. Ofrah gives Starr her bullhorn, to give Starr her voice.
First she's afraid but then screams into the bullhorn and explainexplains everybody Khalil lived and that his life mattered.
